org.pepstock.charba.client.utils

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.utils.Window

  • @JsType(isNative=true,
        namespace="<global>",
        name="window")
public final class Window
extends Object
    The window object represents an open window in a browser.
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero

      • onBeforePrint

static void onBeforePrint(WindowHelper.OnBeforePrintCallback callback)

        Parameters:

      • setTimeout

        static int setTimeout(Window.AsyncCallback function,
                      int delay)
        Sets a timer which executes a function or specified piece of code once the timer expires.
        Parameters:
        function - a function to be executed after the timer expires.
        delay - the time, in milliseconds (thousandths of a second), the timer should wait before the specified function or code is executed.
        If this parameter is omitted, a value of 0 is used, meaning execute "immediately", or more accurately, the next event cycle.
        Returns:
        the returned timer identifier is a positive integer value which identifies the timer created by the call.
        This value can be passed to clearTimeout(int) to cancel the timeout.

      • clearTimeout

        static void clearTimeout(int timeoutID)
        Cancels a timeout previously established by calling setTimeout(AsyncCallback, int) method.
        Parameters:
        timeoutID - the identifier of the timeout you want to cancel.
        This ID was returned by the corresponding call to setTimeout(AsyncCallback, int) method.

      • setInterval

        static int setInterval(Window.AsyncCallback function,
                       int interval)
        Sets a timer which executes repeatedly calls a function with a fixed time delay between each call.
        It returns an interval ID which uniquely identifies the interval.
        Parameters:
        function - a function to be executed repeatedly
        interval - the time, in milliseconds (thousands of a second), the timer should delay in between executions of the specified function
        Returns:
        an interval ID which uniquely identifies the interval

      • clearInterval

        static void clearInterval(int internalID)
        cancels a timed, repeating action which was previously established by a call to setInterval(AsyncCallback, int) method.
        Parameters:
        internalID - the identifier of the repeated action you want to cancel.
        This ID was returned by the corresponding call to setInterval(AsyncCallback, int) method.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Decoded a base-64 encoded string

      • btoa

        public static String btoa(String str)
        Encodes a string in base-64. This method uses the "A-Z", "a-z", "0-9", "+", "/" and "=" characters to encode the string.
        Parameters:
        str - Required. The string to be encoded
        Returns:
        A String, representing the base-64 encoded string

      • enableResizeOnBeforePrint

        @JsOverlay
public static void enableResizeOnBeforePrint()
        CSS media queries allow changing styles when printing a page. The CSS applied from these media queries may cause charts to need to resize. However, the resize won't happen automatically. To support resizing charts when printing, one needs to hook the onbeforeprint event and manually trigger resizing of each chart.
